name: 陳雅玫
objective: This is an introductory course aiming to familiarize students with basic concepts of translation, including qualifications of good translators, the procedure of translation, use of references & electronic tools and the idea of translation equivalence. Also, the relevance of contrastive studies between English and Chinese to translation will be introduced. A guided application of the linguistic knowledge to practical work will be provided, in the interest of assisting students in formulating suitable and appropriate translation strategies and techniques. This course is intended to prepare students for more specialized translation training.
schedule:
Week 1: course introduction
Week 2: lecture on "what makes a good translator?"; exercises
Week 3: lecture on: (1) procedure of translation; (2) references & electrical tools
Week 4: lecture on translation equivalence
Week 5: lecture on contrastive studies of lexicon & translation
Week 6: lecture on contrastive studies of verbs & translation (2)
Week 7: lecture on contrastive studies of nouns and pronouns & translation
Week 8: lecture on contrastive studies of prepositions and articles & translation
Week 9: mid-term
Week 10: lecture on contrastive studies of adjectives and adverbs & translation
Week 11: lecture on contrastive studies of conjunctions and negative constructions & translation
Week 12: lecture on constrastive studies of word order & translation (I)
Week 13: 1. lecture on contrastive studies of word order & translation (II); 2. lecture on contrastive studies of sentence paterns & translation (I)
Week 14: lecture on contrastive studies of sentence patterns & translation (II)
Week 15: lecture on idioms & translation
Week 16: lecture on cultures & translation
Week 17: Review
Week 18: Final exam
materials:
Teaching materials:
(1) instructor’s lecture handouts
(2) selected readings from the following books:
(a) main textbook: 英漢比較與翻譯（陳定安）
(b) supplementary reference: 文體與翻譯 （劉宓慶）
翻譯教程：翻譯的原則與方法 (Peter Newmark)
英漢句型對比與翻譯（陳定安）
